ygData.messageBody:
--- In EverQuest@y..., "J. Smythe" <lgumaer@h...> wrote:
> So if I am a secondary tank I should use the slower weapon in
primary or a 2hander. If I am primary tank or soloing I should use
the faster one in main hand as that will result in the most damage.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Thomas H. Comegys
> To: EverQuest@y...
> Sent: Saturday, April 06, 2002 1:53 PM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Duel Wielding question
>
I dual wield all the time. I seldom resort to my 2 hander in any
situation.

As I understand dual wield you keep the slow, hard hitting weapon in
the off hand. The primary hand gauges how often you swing and how
often you get a dual or double attack. So if you put the slower
weapon in the primary all your strikes are slower. It really doesn't
matter whether you're the main tank or the backup. As soon as you
cast snare you're going to get whacked! So blaze away. And aggro
management is only a minor issue for you, even now. You do need to
learn it, eventually, but it will come to you!

Tuldayen Grimblade
35th (Woohoo!) Ranger of Tunare
